remarks: The composition of two isomorphisms is an isomorphism, and the inverse is the composition of the individual inverses.  Proposition 3.14(2) of [Adamek] p. 29.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Jan-2017.)
statement:

invfval.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
isoval.n $e |- I = ( Iso ` C ) $.
invinv.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( X I Y ) ) $.
invco.o $e |- .x. = ( comp ` C ) $.

invco.f $e |- ( ph -> G e. ( Y I Z ) ) $.
invco $p |- ( ph -> ( G ( <. X , Y >. .x. Z ) F ) ( X N Z ) ( ( ( X N Y ) ` F ) ( <. Z , Y >. .x. X ) ( ( Y N Z ) ` G ) ) ) $.
